headline.main: One Month Into the Afghan War

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Northern Army Says It's Near Key Crossroad'' (news article, Nov. 8) quotes Gen. Peter Pace of the Marine Corps, the vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, as saying Northern Alliance forces have been ''riding horseback into combat against tanks and armored personnel carriers.'' Is the Pentagon thinking that 19th-century tactics will prevail over the relatively well-equipped opposition, or are we unable to supply our allies with modern equipment and train them in using it? JACK STARR New York, Nov. 8, 2001
abstract: Jack Stark letter comments on November 8 article on performance of rebel Northern Alliance in US military campaign in Afghanistan; drawing
